alert.note: Alert for Marion (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 8:59PM CST until January 29 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Pearl River Near Columbia affecting Marion County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Pearl River Near Rockport affecting Copiah and Simpson Counties. Pearl River Near Monticello affecting Lawrence County. For the Lower Pearl River ...including D`lo, Rockport, Monticello, Columbia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River Near Columbia. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Low areas near the river begin to flood. Water covers Old Highway 35 on the west side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CST Thursday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 17.5 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Pearl River Columbia 17.0 16.0 Thu 8 pm CST 17.3 17.2 16.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 24 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 900 AM CST.
